patterns: What is Covid-19?
What is the global pandemic about?
Which virus is spreading is spearding around the world?
What virus is spreading around the world?
responses: COVID-19 is a disease caused by a new strain of coronavirus. 'CO' stands for corona, 'VI' for virus, and 'D' for disease. Formerly, this disease was referred to as '2019 novel coronavirus' or '2019-nCoV.'

patterns: What are the symptoms of Covid-19?
What are the indicators of having Covid-19?
How do you know if you have Covid-19?
responses: The most common symptoms are fever, dry cough, and tiredness. More less common symptoms include aches and pains, sore throat, diarrohea, headache, loss of taste and smell, conjuctivitis and a rash. Some of the more serious symptoms include difficulty breathing, chest pain and loss of speech or movement. Upon any symptoms please contact a local doctor.

patterns: Where can we get tested for Covid-19?
How to get tested for Covid-19?
responses: To find places to get tested, please your goverment website to see all accessible centers available to you. Recieveing your Covid-19 test results can generally take between 1-3 days.

patterns: How to prevent yourself from getting Covid-19?
How to make sure you do not get Covid-19?
What are the things you could do to not get the virus?
responses: Some of the most common ways to prevent yourself from getting Covid-19 is by washing your hands, maintaining a safe distance from others, wearing a mask where physical distancing is not possible, don't touch your eyes, nose and mouth, and staying home if you feel unwell.

patterns: How to treat yourself if you have Covid-19?
What is the treatment for Covid-19?
responses: The treatment for Covid-19 varies, please contact your local doctor for suitable treatment.

patterns: What are the authorized Covid-19 vaccines?
Which are the authorized Covid-19 vaccines?
responses: There are 4 authorized vaccines: AstroZeneca, Jassen, Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech. Which vaccine you are able to get depends on the availability and age group.

patterns: How many vaccine doses does everybody need to get?
responses: Everybody needs to get two doses of the Covid-19 vaccine.

patterns: What are the side-effects of the vaccine?
What are the side-effects of the Covid-19 vaccine?
responses: Some of the common side-effects are redness, soreness and swelling around the injection site. Other side-effects include chills, fatigue, joint pain, headache, mild fever and muscle aches.

patterns: Where can we get the Covid-19 vaccine?
Locations to get Covid-19 vaccine
responses: To find locations that offer Covid-19 vaccine near your home, please visit the government website for a list of locations or visit local pharmacies.
